name: Monkey
tagline: Does what I need, so I can do what I like.
body:
Personal Home/Office Automation Monkey [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/ustuehler/monkey.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/ustuehler/monkey)
--------------------------------------

I'm slowly teaching my monkey to do all the chores that I don't like.  Every
now and then I teach it a new trick, but for now, here's what it can do...

**Accounting**

- manipulates human-readable [ledger](http://ledger-cli.org) files
- imports bank statements in CSV format

**Banking**

- does online-banking via HBCI (using aqbanking-cli)
  - checks account balances
  - issues transfers

**Small-business management**

- keeps track of my customers and suppliers
- generates time-sheets for contract work
- generates invoices ready to send

**E-mail processing**

- received invoices to account for business expenses
- time-recording reports for invoice generation

Note: Not everything is already published, some things are still implemented as
crude Rake scripts, using "monkey" only as a Ruby library.

Usage
-----

My monkey's primary interface is a self-documenting command-line application,
but it can also be used directly from Ruby as library.  I personally prefer to
use pry during development and when I need something from my monkey that can't
be requested yet via the command-line interface.

Here's how to get started:

```text
bundle install
bundle exec bin/monkey
```
